Key Match Events: The Miami Heat lost by 36 points to the Utah Jazz, the largest margin of defeat in four years.
Pre-Game Insights: Heat head coach Erik Spoelstra downplayed the situation with Jimmy Butler as having any impact on the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Tyler Herro and Erik Spoelstra emphasized the need to move past the Jimmy Butler drama and focus on the team's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat are now 17-16, sixth in the Eastern Conference, as they embark on a six-game road trip starting Monday against the Sacramento Kings.
Others: Bam Adebayo did not make a single field goal out of six attempts, a first in his career with at least 25 minutes played.
The Heat were out-rebounded by a large margin, 57-32, the sixth time in team history that another team had at least 25 boards more.
